intro: Hedera cheirophylla, commonly known as the Greek ivy, is a species of flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is native to the eastern Mediterranean region, including parts of Greece, Turkey, and the Middle East. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves that are often lobed or deeply divided. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. Hedera cheirophylla is typically found growing in rocky or woodland areas, often as an epiphyte on trees or cliffs.
